title: Shanks Came to Marineford to Protect the World from Imu
theoryText: One theory suggests that Shanks might have arrived at the Marineford War not just to save Luffy or end the conflict, but to protect the world from Imu. The theory posits that Shanks likely knows of Imu's existence since he's a renowned Celestial Dragon, and perhaps he came to Marineford to protect Luffy in case he awakened the Hito Hito no Mi, Model: Nika. According to this theory, Shanks wasn't there just to save the war but to protect Luffy from potentially awakening his Devil Fruit and attracting Imu's attention at such a vulnerable moment.
author: Various One Piece theorists
evidence: Shanks has mysterious connections to the World Government and has met with the Five Elders
The timing of Shanks' arrival seems too convenient
Shanks' knowledge of the true nature of Luffy's Devil Fruit is hinted at in later story developments
counterEvidence: This theory relies heavily on information not revealed until much later in the story
It potentially diminishes the organic character development and relationships established earlier
Shanks' actions can be explained more simply by his mentorship of Luffy and respect for Whitebeard

title: How Did Shanks Arrive at Marineford So Quickly After Fighting Kaido?
theoryText: One of the biggest mysteries surrounding Episode 489 is how Shanks managed to arrive at Marineford just one day after reportedly fighting with Kaido. Various theories have been proposed: (1) Shanks has access to special travel methods unknown to others, (2) The report of fighting Kaido was exaggerated or misunderstood, (3) Shanks has a special ability or connection that allows for rapid travel, or (4) The timeline is not as tight as it appears. This mystery continues to fuel fan speculation about Shanks' true capabilities and resources.
author: One Piece Fan Community
evidence: Marines explicitly state their shock at Shanks arriving so quickly after the Kaido encounter
The distance between Kaido's location and Marineford should be significant
No explanation is provided in the episode or manga
counterEvidence: The exact details of the Kaido encounter are never fully explained
Timeline compression for narrative purposes is common in One Piece
